bioverse.benchmark

Source code for bioverse.benchmark

import inspect
import os
from abc import ABC
from functools import partial
from multiprocessing import current_process
from pathlib import Path
from typing import Any, Dict, Iterable, List, Tuple, Type, cast

import awkward as ak
from typing_extensions import Self

from .data import Data
from .dataset import Dataset
from .framework import Framework
from .metric import Metric, Result
from .sampler import Sampler
from .task import Task
from .transform import Transform
from .utilities import SHARD_SIZE, config, load, parallelize




[docs]
class Benchmark(ABC):

    dataset: Dataset | Type[Dataset] | Tuple[Type[Dataset], Dict[str, Any]]
    sampler: Sampler | Type[Sampler] | Tuple[Type[Sampler], Dict[str, Any]]
    task: Task | Type[Task] | Tuple[Type[Task], Dict[str, Any]]
    metric: Metric | Type[Metric] | Tuple[Type[Metric], Dict[str, Any]]



[docs]
    def __init__(
        self,
        root: Path | str = config.benchmarks_path,
        version: int = 0,
        partition: str = "main",
        n_jobs: int | None = None,
    ) -> None:
        """
        Parameters
        ----------
        root : Path or str, optional
            Root directory for benchmark data storage, defaults to config.benchmarks_path
        version : int, optional
            Version number of the benchmark, defaults to 0
        partition : str, optional
            Partition name for the benchmark data, defaults to "main"
        n_jobs : int or None, optional
            Number of parallel jobs to run. If None, uses all available cores

        Notes
        -----
        The benchmark class requires the following class attributes to be defined:
        - dataset: Dataset class, instance, or (class, kwargs) tuple
        - sampler: Sampler class, instance, or (class, kwargs) tuple
        - task: Task class, instance, or (class, kwargs) tuple
        - metric: Metric class, instance, or (class, kwargs) tuple
        """
        self.root = Path(root) / f"{self.name}v{version}" / partition
        os.makedirs(self.root, exist_ok=True)
        self.partition = partition
        self.n_jobs = n_jobs

        # initialize components from config, class, or instance
        for attr in ["dataset", "sampler", "task", "metric"]:
            kwargs = getattr(self, attr)
            if isinstance(kwargs, tuple):
                cls, kwargs = kwargs
                setattr(self, attr, cls(**kwargs))
            elif inspect.isclass(kwargs):
                setattr(self, attr, kwargs())
            else:
                setattr(self, attr, kwargs)
        self.dataset = cast(Dataset, self.dataset)
        self.sampler = cast(Sampler, self.sampler)
        self.task = cast(Task, self.task)
        self.metric = cast(Metric, self.metric)



    @property
    def name(self) -> str:
        return self.__class__.__name__

    def apply(self, *transforms: Transform) -> Self:
        self.dataset.apply(*transforms)
        for split in self.dataset.split_names:
            setattr(self, f"{split}_loader", partial(self.loader, split=split))
        return self

    def loader(
        self,
        split: str | None = None,
        batch_size: int = 1,
        batch_on: str = "molecules",
        shuffle: bool = False,
        random_seed: int = config.seed,
        world_size: int = 1,
        rank: int = 0,
        progress: bool = True,
        framework: Framework | None = None,
    ) -> Iterable[Tuple[Tuple[ak.Array, ...], Data | None]]:

        # sample the index
        index, shard_order = self.sampler.sample(
            dataset=self.dataset,
            split=split,
            batch_size=batch_size,
            batch_on=batch_on,
            shuffle=shuffle,
            random_seed=random_seed,
            world_size=world_size,
            rank=rank,
        )

        class ShardBuffer:
            _instances = {}

            @classmethod
            def get_instance(cls, path: Path | str):
                pid = current_process().pid
                if pid not in cls._instances:
                    cls._instances[pid] = ShardBuffer(path)
                return cls._instances[pid]

            def __init__(self, path: Path | str):
                self.path = Path(path)
                self.current_shard = None
                self.data = None

            def __getitem__(self, index: Tuple[ak.Array, ...]):
                shard_index = index[0] // SHARD_SIZE + 1
                scene_index = index[0] % SHARD_SIZE
                shard_set = list(dict.fromkeys(shard_index).keys())
                chunk = [self.load_shard(shard) for shard in shard_set]
                chunk = cast(List[ak.Array], chunk)
                chunk = ak.unflatten(
                    ak.concatenate(chunk, axis=0), [len(i) for i in chunk]
                )
                index_map = {k: v for v, k in enumerate(shard_set)}
                shard_index = [
                    index_map[k] for k in shard_index
                ]  # re-index shards to chunk
                data = chunk[(shard_index, scene_index, *index[1:])]
                return data

            def load_shard(self, shard: int):
                if self.current_shard != shard:
                    self.data = load(self.path / f"{shard}.ak")
                    self.current_shard = shard
                return self.data

        # load shards, apply task, and collate in parallel
        path, task, assets = self.dataset.path, self.task, self.dataset.assets

        def worker(
            batch_index: Tuple[ak.Array, ...],
        ) -> Tuple[Tuple[ak.Array, ...], Data | None]:
            buffer = ShardBuffer.get_instance(path)
            Xy = task(buffer, assets, batch_index)
            Xy = cast(Tuple[ak.Array, ...], Xy)
            data = framework.collate(*Xy) if framework else None
            return Xy, data

        for result in parallelize(
            worker,
            index,
            description="Loader",
            progress=progress and rank == 0,
            total=len(index),
            max_workers=5,
        ):
            yield result

    def evaluate(self, y_true: ak.Array, y_pred: ak.Array) -> None:
        y_true = self.dataset.transform.inverse_transform(y_true)
        y_pred = self.dataset.transform.inverse_transform(y_pred)
        self.metric.update(y_true, y_pred)

    def result(self, *args, **kwargs) -> Result:
        return self.metric.result(*args, **kwargs)
